title: L'argent (1928) Antonin Artaud Brigitte Helm Alfred Abel
description:
A massive silent movie in two parts starring some of the same actors you saw in Metropolis. You can see from this why silent movies were a special art form unto themselves. 

A grasping capitalist of the classic sort works all sorts of devious schemes, only to get his comeuppance in the end - or does he? That last shot is quite funny. It rather reminds me of Dr. Mabuse - The Gambler, which is considered a classic.

Another youtube reseed in mp4 format. The aspect ratio is wrong, but I didn't want to risk degrading the image by running it through SUPER converter.
